properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, rain, and strong winds are expected, especially during the evening commute. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Total rainfall: near 5 mm, except potentially more than 10 mm over the southern Avalon and Burin Peninsulas. Maximum wind gusts: southeasterly up to 80 km/h. Locations: eastern and southeastern Newfoundland. Time span: this afternoon until overnight tonight. Remarks: Snow will spread across the region this afternoon before changing over to rain in the evening. Strong southeasterly winds will also develop late this afternoon, with the highest gusts expected along the coast in the evening. Conditions will improve tonight as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-24T00:51:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T08:52:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3009848216.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard tonight at Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove. Strong northwest winds are causing near-zero visibilities in blowing snow along the Hudson Bay coast. Blizzard conditions will continue until Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T19:18:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T03:19:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0861373141.2021
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Locations: Prince County Time span: ending by early this afternoon. Remarks: Snow will continue across the Island this morning giving total amounts near 15 cm for most of Prince county. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T19:19:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T08:37:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3407869361.2021
Area: Prince County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Locations: Saint John and County, Fundy National Park, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick Time span: this morning. Remarks: Snow will taper to scattered flurries or showers this morning. About 10 to 15 cm of snow has already fallen, with an additional 2 to 5 cm expected. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T16:05:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T08:28:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2206242741.2021
Area: Saint John and County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow is expected. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm, with locally higher amounts possible. Locations: central and northeastern Newfoundland. Time span: Tuesday afternoon to near midday on Wednesday. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across central and northeastern Newfoundland Tuesday afternoon. Winds will strengthen Tuesday night causing blowing snow and reduced visibility, mainly over exposed areas. In the northeast, snow will taper to freezing drizzle or briefly to rain and drizzle on Tuesday night before changing back to snow Wednesday morning. Over central areas, snow will continue into Wednesday morning with further, but minor, accumulations. Snow will taper off over all areas by Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:38:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:39:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2058806646.2021
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions today in Naujaat. Strong northwest winds with gusts to 80 km/h will affect Naujaat today. Blizzard conditions, with near-zero visibility in blowing snow, will result. Blizzard conditions will ease this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-24T02:40:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T10:41:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2462923685.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A multi-day episode of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold wind chill values between minus 55 and minus 60 are expected this morning. While temperatures will moderate somewhat during the day, these extreme cold wind chill values may persist through to the end of the week. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-24T03:30:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T11:31:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3386088978.2021
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, rain, and strong winds are expected. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Total rainfall: 5 to 10 mm, except potentially higher amounts over the southern Avalon and Burin Peninsulas. Maximum wind gusts: up to 80 km/h. Locations: Burin and Avalon Peninsulas. Time span: Tuesday afternoon until overnight Tuesday night. Remarks: Snow or rain will begin near noon Tuesday or later in the afternoon before changing over to rain early in the evening. Strong winds will also develop late Tuesday afternoon, with the highest gusts along the coast in the evening. Conditions will improve Tuesday night as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:35:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:36:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0528211357.2021

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall expected today. Total snowfall: near 10 cm, with higher amounts possible inland and over higher terrain. Maximum wind gusts: southeasterly up to 80 km/h, stronger in the Wreckhouse area. Locations: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity to Connaigre. Time span: midday today until this evening. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across southwestern Newfoundland today before changing to rain or drizzle this evening. Strong winds will cause a brief period of blowing snow and reduced visibility in some locations near midday. Conditions will improve this evening as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-24T00:52:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T08:53:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0955808699.2021
Area: Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southeasterly near 100 km/h in the Wreckhouse area. Time span: this afternoon. ### Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T21:59:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T08:53:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4236392076.2021

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum Les Suetes gusts: 100 km/h. Time span: this morning, diminishing near noon. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T18:29:34-00:00
